website_summaries.verdict: Backed for life by the manufacturer, but doesn't compare when it comes to length.
pros: Manufacturer-backed shoe horn boasts smooth edges and long handle
cons: Taller consumers might not benefit from its 15.5-inch handle, especially in a standing position

customer_reviews.title: What an incredibly useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the long IKEA plastic shoe horns (that look like a snake) for many years. They have been great for getting my shoes on quickly, as I'm often taking my dogs outside and don't wear shoes indoors. The plastic keeps cracking, though, every year or two. I first bought the blue handled ones and now this orange one. Hopefully, these metal ones will last longer. My only suggestion is to make the logo or something on one side more apparent so I can quickly identify the correct side. I used a sticker, which I'm sure will fall off at some point.
customer_reviews.author: outdoortechie

customer_reviews.title: Great Length
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am very pleased with this shoehorn. I wanted something longer than normal but convenient to keep near my couch where I normally put on my boots, which don't slip on easily. This tucks neatly into a book rack by the couch, and is long enough to avoid struggling to reach the boots. I can't say how the handle will hold up, but I'm fairly sure the metal blade will never bend--very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: AvidShopper

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT shoe horn, for a great deal of the day price! There may be issues with the para cord, but i have not had any problems since I pay close attention to the potential issues (as others have warned). The ONLY issue I Have with this unit is that the tip of the tongue is HUGE and not suitable for kid's shoes. Otherwise, it's a great adults shoe horn. (ladies dress shoes may also have issues with this tip of this unit being too wide. Great quality metal though, enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Birello

customer_reviews.title: It's not a shoe *or* a horn.
customer_reviews.text: Some shoehorns that I've seen are so flimsy-feeling that I am afraid to even think about using them. Not this one. It's a strong, curved slab of stainless steel. The handle has cord wrapped and tied around it to soften the handle. If you've been wearing out the heels on your shoes when you try to slip them on (when you don't feel like untying them), this is the item you want. It's not too big or small, and can be used in a standing or sitting position with ease--though it's easier if you're seated.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's a good shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Shoe horns are simple devices so there's not a lot to say. This one is sturdy. Its metal blade does not bend out of shape. It is long enough for me to reach my shoes. The lacing at the top meant to aid my grip works well. Some comments are that the lacing unravels. Mine hasn't unraveled. If you have a pair of very stiff shoes that are difficult to get your feet into, this shoe horn will make the process a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: SMB 69

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: At first, it seemed large, probably only because I'm used to dinky little shoe horns. Actually, the size is fine and it fits in the shoe behind the heel just as it should. I like the hanger, which is an extension of the leather-wrapped gripper portion. It is secured with a knot, so I suppose the reviewers for whom it came apart weren't respectful of leather bindings.
customer_reviews.author: Allen H. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job!
customer_reviews.text: Great size, easy to hold, used for a pair of my cross trainer shoes that were impossible to get on. Slipped right on.That was the whole reason I bought it. So in a sense, it saved me wasting $100.00 for a pair of shoes I couldn't get use without it! Good length and like the leather grip around the handle. Very sturdy since not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: would have given 5 stars, but as others reviews, the binding unraveled shortly after using it ~ but still a lot better than the plastic ones that break shortly after using
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but . . .
customer_reviews.text: The shoe horn is very nice, easy to use and the perfect length. Unfortunately, the cord wrapped around the handle was unraveling when I received it. I knotted the cord then glued it to the handle. I hope this holds. I don't know why this problem hasn't been addressed by now.
customer_reviews.author: Kittery

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last year and that one is excellent. It is one solid piece of metal. This one is flimsy and instard of a solid peice of metal this one has to two tongs that the cord is wrapped around. It will definitely bend easily. Don't waste your money on this, get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: murdock415

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Shoe Horn
customer_reviews.text: I use a custom brace for a fallen arch that is hard to get into my shoes or slippers. I mainly chose this because it was larger than a regular (small) shoe horn. It is thick enough to be really sturdy & the cord wrapped handle makes it comfortable to use. It easily helps me guide the brace into my shoe & will probably be the last one I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Zilla

customer_reviews.title: Get it, chubs!
customer_reviews.text: Are you big and fat or tall and have a tough time getting your boots in? All sweaty after bending down and struggling to get your foot in a tight pair of Iron Rangers? Yeah, me too. Well, no longer do you have to fight around your gut to get on your shoes, friends! If you are short, this bad boy is so long you might not have to bend over to reach your feet!! Basically, if you don’t have a shoe horn, buy this. It’s cheap, and it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe horn. I got some really nice shoes that didn't have much give to them so I struggled to get my feet into them. This was a great way to solve that problem. Using this makes it super easy to get your shoes on. The only downside I see is the cord that is used to make a handle for it. I could forsee that coming undone in the future and then making it very hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Vail

customer_reviews.title: i love it and know that i'll never need another one ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a very well constructed shoe horn. i love it and know that i'll never need another one every again. it's a little big but you can easily keep it under a shoe shelf or propped up against a door. it helps me put on my boots every morning and also helps with regular loafers as well.
customer_reviews.author: kimcd9

customer_reviews.title: Very tactical looking shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: I fended off several ninja warriors and on Viking with this shoe horn. Turns out they were all just out for sushi, and I got charged for battery, but my shoes were on easily. Note the length of the horn at 16-18", or as listed. It's not the longest, but looks the coolest.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE HORN PERFECT LENGTH
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe horn, the length is perfect for e, I'm a tall guy 6' 2" and I do not need to do a deep knee bend or toe touch to put my shoes on using this nice study metal shoe horn. I like that it has a leather loop at the handle, I hang it from the drawer knob of my dreess so it's handy located when I put my shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Stop buying plastic shoe horns
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing a number of similar shoe horns made of plastic only to have them snap when using them I decided to spend a bit more and get something that wouldn't break... and this is it! Work great and so sturdy! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Clint C

customer_reviews.title: Good size and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a good size and easy to use but the roping on the handle came undo and we had to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: finss2left

customer_reviews.title: Man Oh Man...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it's the little things that make life great. This is one of them. No more crushing the backs of my shoes because I am too lazy to sit down and put them on. This baby solves all that. Makes all of the difference in the world. Yeah, I know I am talking about a shoe horn. First thing I pack when going on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Droptop

customer_reviews.title: Not sure but we'll see.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the handle was "hollow," but it seems pretty solid regardless, and the horn does its job well, so if it should fail somehow I'll just cut it down for my travel kit and get a more solid long-handled horn from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Brock

customer_reviews.title: Handle unravels, good shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: The shoe horn itself does the job, it’s just that the Handle wrap comes undone easily. I’ve only used it probably 8 times and when I’m not using it it’s never touched so Idk why handle comes unraveled so easily, other than that shoe horn does what it’s made for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Ergonomic and easy to use shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy metal shoe horn that will live for years. we love it. The old horn we had was plastic and broke in a few months. This one is in metal and very strong. I also like the contour which makes it very ergonomic to use. The length of the horn is right sized to help you to use it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Manikandan Nambiar

customer_reviews.title: Strong and A Good Length
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a long handled metal shoe horn for shoes that keep bending in the back. This one fit the bill. The length is good and the metal is strong. The handle has a good grip and it hangs so it is very handy to grab hold of in the morning when I'm getting dressed.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy T. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: ... an amputee and I have to use something ginormous like this to get most footwear on my metal foot
customer_reviews.text: I am an amputee and I have to use something ginormous like this to get most footwear on my metal foot, especially things like boots. This is perfect. I was able to get my snow and snowboard boots on using this sucker. Fast shipping. I would order again : )
customer_reviews.author: Mark Spoonire

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine. The only thing that would be a little better is if the end was a little more rounded or curved to fit better in a shoe as I'm putting it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy shoe horn. I use it primarily to put my Asics on to avoid the back of the shoe folding in. Also, I don't have to untie/tie my shoelaces when using the horn. Very handy!
customer_reviews.author: CMC

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for getting your hard to get on shoes. You don't have to get down low to slide your shoe on. Really great if you have back issues. I also love the color of the handle to. It is very comfortable to use and the packaging was great just slide the horn out of the bag. I couldn't asked for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Oneparrot2many

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I need. I am not as limber as I once was and getting my shoes on has become more challenging. The standard size shoe horn still forced me to bend to the floor to use it - a painful process these days. This shoe horn is extra long allowing me to use it without bending so far. It is made of sturdy metal and contoured just right to slide my foot into the shoes. Top it off with a rope type handle and loop makes it comfortable to use and able to be hung close to my shoes so it's always ready and available to help.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: I love this long handled shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: I love this long handled shoe horn! I use it for slipping into my boots, high tops, soft suede dress shoes, and tennis shoes. I don't have to bend over with a regular sized shoe horn and it saves stress on my shoulders and back.
customer_reviews.author: sparkygirl

customer_reviews.title: Shoe horn with longer handle
customer_reviews.text: It’s a shoehorn- like any other but with a longer handle so my hubby can get his new shoes (loafers) on
customer_reviews.author: S. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Yep--it is well worht the modest cost.
customer_reviews.text: I have an arthritic body which makes the simple task of putting on my shoes unassisted an impossibility.. This item, an elongated shoe horn works GREAT. I am dependent only on myself--I like that very much.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Rodney

customer_reviews.title: The horn itself is very good and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: It is quite strong but I expected it to be a little small because I was hoping it would in a certain spot in my shelf. But that is my personal complain. The horn itself is very good and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Entropy

customer_reviews.title: This product is STURDY and perfect
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift for my Father. He loves his Merrell Jungle Mocs but has lost some of his mobility due to a hip replacement. This product is STURDY and perfect!! With the gripped handle it makes it easy to hold!!!
customer_reviews.author: A.Illig

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Built Shoe Horn
customer_reviews.text: So, this shoe horn is definitely a little over-sized. I like that it's metal and seems perfectly able to stand up to a little abuse. I think the size makes it easier to put shoes on while standing. We're happy with the purchase, and my husband thrilled that he doesn't have to battle is dress shoes every time we need to dress up :).
customer_reviews.author: webster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very well-pleased. Merchandise is exactly as advertised. Prompt delivery. I would not hesitate to do further business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe horn for getting into tight boots
customer_reviews.text: I normally have a hard time putting on lace-up boots, so this is a life saver! Easy to reach boots without leaning over while sitting. The shoe horn is flat enough to accommodate my heel without digging in. Thin enough to allow you to squeeze in, and the textured grip prevents any slipping.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: not a pair of shoes - nice and stiff and well made and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe horn, not a pair of shoes - nice and stiff and well made and useful. Excellent product and handsome too. However, the handle has started to unravel... ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pinkowitz

customer_reviews.title: You do not wear a Shoe Horn!
customer_reviews.text: The product does not really "FIT" I am not sure who put it into this category - you do not "WEAR" a shoe horn. However, this is a very effective tool to assist in getting into your shoes and protecting the heal of the shoe from bending and breaking. Well made and good size for its task.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Lou

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy Shoehorn
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase a big help to my husband when his feet swells and has difficulty getting shoes on. Glad they still make them. This one is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: marie nelson

customer_reviews.title: Makes simple tasks easier
customer_reviews.text: I have knee and hip problems and this is a great help in getting my shoes on and off. Wish I had gotten it sooner. I like that it is longer than most, which keeps me from having to bend so far over.
customer_reviews.author: savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and strong
customer_reviews.text: I am so surprised that this is such high quality for such a small price. I wasn't sure about the strange bend in it at first but then once I used it, I saw the reason it was there. My foot slips right into my tight boots without wearing down the back inside lining of the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Carlottia

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for getting on my new lace up ladies ankle boots. love the wrapped handle. very well made. very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Land

customer_reviews.title: and i absolutely love it. It doesn't deform under heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it to squeeze into my work boots, and i absolutely love it. It doesn't deform under heavy use, it has a comfortable shape that my heel slides along easily and without discomfort, and the handle is easy to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Sell

customer_reviews.title: The shoe horn would be great if it was about 7 or 8 in longer.
customer_reviews.text: I just had a full hip replacement and I can't bend past 90 degrees. I had long handled plastic shoe horns that broke. This is why I got the metal one but am a little disappointed that the handle is not longer. It's a little difficult for me to put the shoes on since I can't bend past 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight shoes no problem
customer_reviews.text: Great for putting on those tight dress-shoes without creasing your pants. Cord does tend to get loose on the handle after a while though.
customer_reviews.author: darryl u

customer_reviews.title: Too flat.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the metal end were more convex, it's almost flat.
customer_reviews.author: L  LaBo

customer_reviews.title: Not too long, not too short
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length for me. Not long enough to use from a standing position, but great from a sitting position.
customer_reviews.author: iamanooj

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for putting on snug shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the review questions aren't relevant to this product. Since it's description starts with "shoe" it asks questions about comfort and fit. It's a shoehorn, works like every other shoehorn.
customer_reviews.author: Alban J Butler

customer_reviews.title: the perfect shor horn
customer_reviews.text: it works great. it's long enough that you don't have to strain to put on your shoe. it's strong and well formed. the handle is easy to hold. I love it
customer_reviews.author: The Man, Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Great little Horn!
customer_reviews.text: Length is Just Right. Thicker and stiffer then one I have that kept bending - this one probably won't bend if you step on it. Threw the old one away!
customer_reviews.author: Larry B. McPhail

customer_reviews.title: A Behemoth of a Shoe Horn
customer_reviews.text: Works well, however it would be better (IMHO) if the business end wasn't quite as wide. After reading negative reviews regarding the paracord I applied a couple drops of super glue to keep it in place.........there's no way it'll come loose now.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe horn. The length is good for my father who has a hard time reaching his feet to put on his shoes. This has really helped. The shoe horn is pretty sturdy. Only complaint is the handle could be better. The cord came undone after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: ImJoeMan

customer_reviews.title: It's great for getting on my work boots that the heel ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a really long shoe horn. It's great for getting on my work boots that the heel is a little worn. I am thinking that it won't wear out too soon because its metal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hall

customer_reviews.title: Too big. The end of it has sharp corners ...
customer_reviews.text: Too big. The end of it has sharp corners and is so wide that it scratches the inside edge of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: The leather strap keeps coming undone but hey it still does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: BrewCity

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy metal and performs well...
customer_reviews.text: It works great putting on footwear that is a bit tight. One problem is the handle which is wrapped with cord that tends to slide off when pulling on it which you can prevent by pulling on the loop instead.
customer_reviews.author: KMBuck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: You know what a shoehorn is supposed to do, this shoehorn with it's extra length and thickness does that job perfectly. If you allow the knot in the cord to loosen then it will unravel. Do yourself a favor and put a drop of superglue on the knot and forget about it.
customer_reviews.author: Old Rider

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY SHOEHORN
customer_reviews.text: Great shoehorn. Heavy duty materials. This thing could also be used as a protection weapon. However I wish it was 2 inches longer so an elderly person wouldn't have to sit and bend over so much to put on his shoes. I bought 3 of these. One for home use, one for travel and one for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Is the perfect size for my elderly dad to get his shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Is the perfect size for my elderly dad to get his shoes on. It's not too tall it's not too short and it's just the right width! It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: robin robertson

customer_reviews.title: Strong shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a solid shoe horn, but the joke is the rope you see that's just twirled on there and eventually starts to slide off since it's not glued or secured in any way. No big deal, the long handle and thick metal makes up for that
customer_reviews.author: Eric Torianyk

customer_reviews.title: Strong and helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Helpful for me as I am having more trouble getting close to my feet. Very solid. Bonus: My dogs love it for scriches! Negative: The string wrap on the handle comes loose and has to be redone periodically.
customer_reviews.author: dennisinseattle

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Ideal shoe horn. I use it every day and does the job well. The only part subject to wear and tear is the hanging loop and the string on the top. They are holding very well with no issues. This will last for loooong time.
customer_reviews.author: Anomaly

customer_reviews.title: Shoe Horn Review
customer_reviews.text: The product works well but the string wrapped handle has an issue because the string keeps coming undone. I had to finally glue the string at the top to keep it from coming undone. Once I glued the string it is now a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe Horn
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe horn not a shoe so the questions in the review don't apply. What I like is that the handle is long so I don't have to reach so far to use it. It's also very smooth and the metal makes it very durable. Exactly what I wanted and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. The "string" they wrapped around the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. The "string" they wrapped around the shoehorn would have been nicer if they glued it in place because it keeps slipping off the end of it. I may end up doing this myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Lidston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality!! The shoe horn has a nice weight to it - not heavy, not light, but feels solid. The handle is wrapped nicely and provides a solid grip. Very easy to slide it in the shoe and slide your foot into the shoe and pull the shoe horn out.
customer_reviews.author: J_Mas

customer_reviews.title: It is also very sturdy and doesn't bend
customer_reviews.text: This shoe horn is a huge help for my husband. He doesn't have to bend over to get his shoes on. He loves it. It is also very sturdy and doesn't bend !!
customer_reviews.author: Mfk

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would prefer a better padded handle, the black completely unraveled the first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Turner

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect! Strong and well constructed but compact
customer_reviews.text: Finally! This is perfect! Strong and well constructed but compact. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Steve A Eckhoff

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and length is much appreciated
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money, sturdy and length is much appreciated! Most stores no longer carry any decent shoe horns of any at all. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: E. Giovengo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is not a pair of shoes. It is only a devise to help putting your shoes on. Great product. Sturdy metal with comfortable hand hold that helps you avoid slippage. There is no comparison between this devise and cheaper plastic units. Will purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: It works good but the string comes off easily and I have to wind it back on. I ended up just taking it off. Pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great Shoe Horn. It has a substantial weight, and seems very well manufactured. I'm Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: How have I lived without this?
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This shoe horn makes me ridiculously happy for such a simple item. It's very sturdy so have no worries about that.
customer_reviews.author: Galt44

customer_reviews.title: This is a heavy duty shoe horn and worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty shoe horn and worth the price in my opinion. I"ve had plastic ones that broke, This will probably last a long time. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: sanman1973

customer_reviews.title: Helpful feet
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful to put rubber shoes on. Love long handl
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Simon

customer_reviews.title: I always need a shoe horn, so why not ...
customer_reviews.text: I always need a shoe horn, so why not use one that you don't have to bend over as far as the smaller ones.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter's Grove

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Massively helps with putting on form fitting boots. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I USE EVERY DAY AND I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: MOST SHOE HORNS THIS SIZE BEND AFTER INITIAL USE. NOT THIS ONE, I USE EVERY DAY AND I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT ....BUY IT
customer_reviews.author: RJTHEPROWLER

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Shoe horn is very sturdy and just what I wanted. The handle is long enough so you don't have to do a lot of bending, and being metal it won't break like the plastic ones do after a while. Arrived exactly as estimated.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck in Port Richey, Fl

customer_reviews.title: so this extra length shoehorn is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple concept, I wear loafers every day and it is much easier to put them on without having to bend down to do so, so this extra length shoehorn is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Not a shoe BUT it's great for them; especially LARGER sizes...
customer_reviews.text: Great for LARGER sizes and boots plus it's very sturdy and strong and avoids EXTRA stress to the heels of ones dress shoes and boots. I also like the style of it - it's very easy to use. A great addition to the closet of any BIG Man.
customer_reviews.author: PhatGyrl

customer_reviews.title: These make it easy to put on shoes withoug bending wy over
customer_reviews.text: Getting little disabled from cancer. These make it easy to put on shoes withoug bending wy over.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Fry IV

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: This shoe horn is excellent! I had a plastic one that broke on the 3rd use. This shoe horn isn't going to do that. In addition, it looks really nice. I hung it from a hook on the wall and it looks like a nice decoration. Thank you Nalutar.
customer_reviews.author: G. Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality shoehorn;perfect length . I use it to get into my new work boots that are still a little to stiff yet to get on;otherwise I'll tear the finger pull again thats sewn onto top of boot above heal. Stainless steel will last forever;this was well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MRL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: I tried a short medal shoe horn and couldn't use it at all. Next was a light weight medal one that bent every time until was almost ready to give out. This one works perfect every day.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It is a quality product and I like it very much. It is nice to have a durable shoe horn. Only plastic ones are available locally and they quickly break.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie bruce

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: No longer squeezing fingers to get shoes on also make it easier on the back, no longer need to bend like a pretzel to put on my shoes. The metal edge did have a burr that had to be filed off so as not to snag my socks
customer_reviews.author: Slickdome

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well made shoe horn. The longer style makes using the shoe horn very convenient. I feel the price was a bargain for the quality of the item. My local cobbler's shoe horns were much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really, really works. if you have trouble bending over with a small show horn. metal is solid and durable. May have to glue or rewrap the handle part.
customer_reviews.author: Bob67

customer_reviews.title: like
customer_reviews.text: A true help if you are weak handed, like me
customer_reviews.author: Practical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Like how the handle bends to your liking
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised.. Like how the handle bends to your liking. Only drawback is that it's thick at the bottom, which makes it harder to get your foot in the shoe and then pull the horn out.
customer_reviews.author: AKC

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! It was hard for me to put on my Uggs because I felt like I was forcing my foot in and scared I would break the bows on the back. Once I received this my foot slides in with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great new spin on a good ol' tool!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe horn is a super classy tool! My husband and I both use it and we also bought one for our 10 year old grandson. He keeps it in his sports bag and uses it to get his various athletic shoes on quickly. I wondered at first about the longer handle but it gives great leverage which is probably why it's good for kids and older people.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: Handle should not have been rope
customer_reviews.text: Too big. Looks like a machete. And the wiry handle got untied, so now it's difficult to tie it back and the string just hangs around.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsEternal

customer_reviews.title: metal part is designed well and strong, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: metal part is designed well and strong, but the wrapped cording fell off and unraveled very quickly, making handle impossible to use without hurting hand.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sena

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe horn is perfect for my husband. It is very sturdy, high quality, and attractive. He has problems bending over and the length is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Day

customer_reviews.title: Shoe horn good quality, grip cord poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: The metal portion is just the right length, shape, and looks like it will last a very long time. The cord grip is rapidly becoming a problem. It is already slipping off of the metal and unreavelling
customer_reviews.author: DMiller

customer_reviews.title: Overall a sturdy product. Could stand to be a couple inches ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a sturdy product. Could stand to be a couple inches longer for cowboy boots: I did measure beforehand, so I knew what to expect. Satisfied and have recommended to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hollifield

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful - and age has nothing to do with IT !! LOL
customer_reviews.text: You don't want to ruin the heels of your shoes or boots - right?? This product comes in so very handy. I leave it right near my seat that I use to put my shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: XaQaRa
